snippet: After 100 days as mayor, Bill de Blasio is sleeping less than six hours a night, stealing downtime with his son and pledging to “focus even more deeply” on the grass-roots-activist style he took to City Hall.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, in a wide-ranging interview, portrays his administration as having kept its pledge to combat inequality, image he plans to emphasize in speech at Cooper Union on his 100th day in office; vows to 'focus even more deeply' on grass-roots-activist style he has imported to City Hall.
lead_paragraph: After 100 days as mayor, Bill de Blasio is sleeping less than six hours a night, stealing downtime with his son and pledging to “focus even more deeply” on the grass-roots-activist style he took to City Hall.

headline.main: Missteps Aside, de Blasio Looks to Focus Anew on Activist Style
headline.print_headline: Missteps Aside, de Blasio Looks to Focus Anew on Activist Style
